      • invokeMethod

        public java.lang.String invokeMethod()
        Invokes the method and returns the rewardItem (If the reward invocation was successful). First, the game invokes all arguments that are methods and replaces the argument that the method occupied with its output. Next, the game determines if the field is a Field or a TFMethod. If it is a FieldMethod, then it invokes the method and sets the fieldvalue to the output of the field method (the fieldvalue is a local variable, that is used in invoking the method). If it is a regular Field, then set fieldvalue to the value that the field
        Returns:
        If successful, rewardItem. If not, return null.

      • resetArguments

        public static void resetArguments()
        Sets the arguments to the originalArguments. The method loops through each argument and invokes resetArguments() on each TFMethod. It invokes resetArguments() on the field if it is a FieldMethod.
